ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Great. The class is open to a lot of different interests.
Yes. I would recommend the course because it represents such a unique opportunity.
I would recommend the course, certainly.

Description: Art, Media, and Space was a class about contemporary image production and distribution, which spans fine art and more popular media.I would recommend the class because of the readings and the discussions, particularly when they were centered on specific artist examples.
I would recommend the class to anyone interested in art or film. I know that sounds broad, but I feel we covered a broad amount of topics.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: The course was extremely helpful in developing new insights into my research. The professors are extremely insightful and it was great to get their perspective on my work.
I am not responsible for a dissertation, but this course certainly broadened my disciplinary knowledge.

The course provided very useful forum for engaging with some of the most current theoretical work in media studies and art history and with current examples of the shifting boundaries between art and media in contemporary creative practice. Some of the material may prove to be of use in my dissertation.

This class helped me give substance to my thesis, which was primarily about the media. The readings I was exposed to, as well as the artists we discussed in class were also valuable. The exposure to the dialogue of students from other departments, like architecture, art history and film studies was also very positive.
